newsitem.title: USA: Saba wins bidding for Indonesia production.
newsitem.headline: Saba wins bidding for Indonesia production.

text.p: Saba Petroleum Co on Thursday said it has won the initial round of bidding to negotiate a production sharing contract in a 1.7 million acre oil field in Indonesia.
The contract, awarded by the Indonesia state-owned oil company called Pertamina, covers production in the exploration block known as Jatiluhur.

The initial three-year commitment is about $19 million, including cash bonus, seismic and drilling costs is about $19 million. Negotiations are set tp begin by March. A final deal is expected to take "several months" to finalize, Saba said.
A joint operating body would administer the contract. Saba would hold a 75-percent interest and Pertamina would hold the remaining 25-percent.
The Jatiluhur block is onshore on the Island of Java near the city of Jakarta.
